text.front:
On the error of computing ab + cd using
Cornea, Harrison and Tang's method
Jean-Michel Muller
CNRS, Laboratoire LIP
(CNRS, ENS Lyon, Inria, Univ. Claude Bernard Lyon 1)
jean-michel.muller@ens-lyon.fr
September 2013
Abstract
In their book Scientific Computing on The Itanium [1], Cornea, Harrison
and Tang introduce an accurate algorithm for evaluating expressions of
the form ab + cd in binary floating-point arithmetic, assuming an FMA
instruction is available. They show that if p is the precision of the floating-
point format and if u = 2 −p , the relative error of the result is of order
u. We improve their proof to show that the relative error is bounded by
2u+7u 2 +6u 3 . Furthermore, by building an example for which the relative
error is asymptotically (as p → ∞ or, equivalently, as u → 0) equivalent to
2u, we show that our error bound is asymptotically optimal.
